name: vsextensionforvb
description: Enhances .NET support with focus on VB.NET parity with C# for navigation, IntelliSense, and refactoring.

commands.title: VSExtensionForVB: Check Language Client Bridge Compatibility

vsextensionforvb.enableForCSharp.description: Enable parity checks and helper workflows for C# files.

vsextensionforvb.enableForVisualBasic.description: Enable parity checks and helper workflows for VB.NET files.

vsextensionforvb.preferredLanguageServer.description: Preferred .NET language service stack for navigation, IntelliSense, and refactoring features.

vsextensionforvb.autoCheckToolingOnStart.description: Automatically check for required .NET language tooling when VS Code startup completes.

vsextensionforvb.promptToInstallMissingT.description: Show install guidance prompts when .NET language extensions are missing.

vsextensionforvb.statusRefreshDelayMs.description: Debounce delay in milliseconds for refreshing the VB parity status indicator.

vsextensionforvb.enableLanguageClientBri.description: Enable the optional .NET language-client bridge scaffold.

vsextensionforvb.enableBridgeForCSharp.description: Route C# documents through the language-client bridge. Keep this off unless your configured server supports C#.

vsextensionforvb.enableBridgeForVisualBa.description: Route VB.NET documents through the language-client bridge. Keep this off unless your configured server supports Visual Basic.

vsextensionforvb.languageClientServerCom.description: Server command used by the optional language-client bridge (for example, a Roslyn LSP host executable).

vsextensionforvb.languageClientServerArg.description: Arguments passed to the configured language-client bridge server command.

vsextensionforvb.languageClientTraceLeve.description: Trace level for the optional language-client bridge.

vsextensionforvb.autoBootstrapRoslynBrid.description: Automatically configure and enable the Roslyn bridge on first run when a compatible C# extension installation is detected.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run build:server && npm run package
scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
